title: Ticket #2289: DedicatedScheduler name does NOT include username?
description:
http://www.cs.wisc.edu/condor/manual/v7.6/3_13Setting_Up.html#sec:Config-Dedicated-Jobs claims: "If running personal Condor, the name of the scheduler includes the user name it was started as..." and thus that the DedicatedScheduler should look like "DedicatedScheduler@username@full.host.name"

As far as I can tell, a personal Condor (assuming this just means, "Condor running as myself, not root) does not add "adesmet@" to the schedd's name. Doing so in the DedicatedScheduler setting causes jobs to not run. removing the "adesmet@" allows them to run.

Proposed fix: Strike the following from the manual: 

  If running personal Condor, the name of the scheduler includes the user name it was started as, so the configuration appears as:


  DedicatedScheduler = "DedicatedScheduler@username@full.host.name"
  STARTD_ATTRS = $(STARTD_ATTRS), DedicatedScheduler

gthain: Can you verify the above? Perhaps the username@ appears under circumstances I'm not aware of.
remarks:
2011-Oct-27 10:58:06 by smoler:
Greg T. says that the above is not true, and that the documentation is actual correct (there's a first time for everything!) in this case. So this ticket will be resolved, with no changes to the documentation.
creator: adesmet
